required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Testosteron Replacement Treatment on the Fibroblast Growth Factor-23, Asymmetric Dimethylarginine and Vitamin D Levels in the Congenital Hypogonadotropic Hypogonadism
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4 Study of Effect of Testosteron Replacement Treatment on the Fibroblast Growth Factor-23, Asymmetric Dimethylarginine and Vitamin D Levels in the Congenital Hypogonadotropic Hypogonadism

brief_summary.textblock:
The study is designed to answer the following questions:
1) What is the effect of testosteron replacement treatment on the endothelial dysfunction.
2/ What is the effect of testosteron replacement on the bone mineral metabolism.

detailed_description.textblock: this is an interventional study which is examine the effect of testosteron replacement treatment on the endothelial dysfunction and bone mineral metabolism in hypogonadotropic hypogonadal patients.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: the effect of testosteron replacement treatment on the Fibroblast Growth Factor-23.
primary_outcome.description: Plasma FGF-23 levels were determined by ELISA, (Human Intact FGF-23 ELISA Kit, Inc., San Clement, CA, USA).

primary_outcome.measure: the effect of testosteron replacement treatment on the asymmetric dimethylarginine.
primary_outcome.description: Plasma ADMA levels were determined by ELISA (Immunodiagnostic, Bernheim, Germany)

primary_outcome.measure: the effect of testosteron replacement treatment on the vitamin D levels.
primary_outcome.description: Plasma 25-OH vitamin D3 levels were measured by Immuchrom kits (Hessen, Germany) using isocratic HPLC method with UV detector in Prominence HPLC system.

arm_group.description: testosterone 250 mg injection per 3-4 weeks for 6 months

intervention.description: Testosterone 250 mg injection per 3-4 weeks for 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men
- Congenital hypogonadism
- Treatment Naive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous history of androgen replacement
- Hypertension
- Diabetes mellitus
